result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody M. Valdez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

Complete SAFE Intake Program and any follow through.  

AODA and follow through.  

Contact with victims may continue unless agent says otherwise. 

Pay any restitution if requested.  

DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody M. Valdez

records.addlTxt: Brought from Lincoln County on Writ

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 9:20 am.
INCLUDES: 19CM796, 19CM1546, 21CM260, 22CF441 & 22CM20.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ (from Lincoln Co), and with Attorney Sharon Gisselman.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State notes 22CF441 is not included in the global offer due to Attorney Gisselman not yet being appointed. 

State moves to: 
19CM796 --
Ct.1(Battery)>>DRI.

19CM1546 --
Ct.2(Misd BJ)>>DRI.

21CM260 --
Ct.1(Retail Theft - After Price (<=$500))>>DRI.

22CM20 --
Ct.2(DC)>>DRI.
Ct.3(Misd BJ)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
19CM796 --
Ct.2(DC/Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY.

19CM1546 --
Ct.1(Misd BJ)>>GUITLY.

22CM20 --
Ct.1(Battery)>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS on ALL COUNTS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Complete SAFE Intake Program and any follow through.  Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. AODA and follow through.  Contact with victims may continue unless agent says otherwise.  Pay any restitution if requested.  Pay CC/DV surcharge.  Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample.

Stipulation re: credit to be done. 
PRH: 8/12 at 1:15 pm.

State moves to quash warrant in 22CF441.
COURT GRANTS
IA needs to be set; 

Parties would like to take care of IA today in branch 6 at 2:00 pm.

Initial Appearance to be had in 22CM20 at this time: 
Copy of Criminal Complaint has been provided to defendant and he has read and reviewed. 

Adj: 9:36 am.
Plea hearing on June 27, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Calendar call on June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
